projects.title: Lana Del Rey Dashboard
projects.description:
The Lana Del Rey Dashboard is an interactive data and design project that explores Lana Del Reyâ€™s music, discography, and artistic evolution through a structured dashboard experience.

The project focuses on transforming music-related data into a visually cohesive and easy-to-navigate interface, inspired by Lana Del Reyâ€™s cinematic, nostalgic, and melancholic aesthetic. The dashboard presents her body of work in a way that is both informative and visually engaging, allowing users to explore:

ğŸµ Albums, songs, and release timelines across different eras
ğŸ“Š Trends and patterns within her discography, including releases and musical output over time
ğŸ¨ Aesthetic-driven visuals inspired by Lana Del Reyâ€™s imagery and mood
ğŸ“ Organized views of music data for intuitive exploration and comparison

This project emphasizes frontend development, data presentation, and visual storytelling, demonstrating how structured data can be transformed into a calm, immersive dashboard experience.

Frontend: React + TypeScript + Next.js for a responsive, dashboard-style user interface.
Data Handling: Structured music metadata processed and displayed through reusable components.
UI Design: Clean layouts and visual hierarchy inspired by Lana Del Reyâ€™s artistic themes.
Deployment: Hosted on Vercel for fast, scalable performance.
projects.headline: Exploring Lana Del Rey Through Data & Design

projects.title: Bed Bath & Beyond
projects.headline: ğŸ› ï¸ Bed Bath & Beyond Retail R Shiny Dashboard (ETW2001)
projects.description:
The Bed Bath & Beyond Dashboard is an interactive data visualization project developed using R Shiny, focused on exploring retail and product-related data through a dynamic, user-driven dashboard.

This project simulates a real-world retail analytics scenario by organizing and presenting Bed Bath & Beyond data in a clear and structured interface. The dashboard allows users to interactively explore key aspects of the business, supporting better understanding of trends and patterns through visual analytics. Key features of the dashboard include:

ğŸ›’ Overview of product categories and assortments
ğŸ“¦ Interactive analysis of inventory, pricing, and product distribution
ğŸ“Š Visual exploration of trends and patterns across retail data
ğŸ” User-controlled filters and inputs for dynamic data exploration

The project emphasizes the use of R Shiny for building reactive web applications, demonstrating how statistical data and business information can be transformed into an accessible, interactive dashboard suitable for decision support.

Framework: R Shiny for interactive web-based dashboards.
Data Processing: R (dplyr, tidyr) for data cleaning, transformation, and aggregation.
Visualization: ggplot2 and Shiny UI components for clear and responsive charts.
Interactivity: Reactive inputs and server logic to enable real-time data updates.
Deployment: Hosted as a Shiny application for easy access and demonstration

projects.title: Ocean Odyssey
projects.headline: Relational Database Design for a Cruise Booking Platform
projects.description:
Ocean Odyssey is a cruise booking platform modeled using relational database principles, designed to demonstrate structured data modeling, normalization, and schema implementation.

The project focuses on building a realistic database system for a cruise company, using industry-standard database design concepts to ensure data consistency and efficiency. The platform includes a complete entity relationship model and supports common booking workflows, with an emphasis on accurate and scalable database architecture. Key features include:

ğŸ§­ Entity design and relationship mapping for cruises, customers, bookings, cabins, and destinations
ğŸ§± Normalization to reduce redundancy and improve data integrity
ğŸ“Œ Schema generation using Oracle tools for reliable database implementation
ğŸ“Š Structured database design supporting real-world booking scenarios

This project demonstrates core database engineering skills, including data modeling, relational design, and practical use of Oracle database tools for schema creation and management.

Tools: Oracle Database for schema generation and database management.
Database Design: Entity-Relationship (ER) modeling, normalization (1NF/2NF/3NF), and relational schema design.
Implementation: SQL scripts and database objects for tables, keys, constraints, and relationships.
Documentation: Clear data model diagrams and structured schema documentation for easy understanding and scalability.

projects.title: NutriTrack
projects.headline: ğŸ Nutrition Tracking App with AI
projects.description:
NutriTrack is a nutrition tracking app designed to help users monitor their daily food intake and maintain healthier eating habits. The project combines a user-friendly interface with a real-time AI-powered interaction system to provide personalized nutrition insights.

The app allows users to log meals, track nutrient intake, and receive instant feedback through an AI chat feature. The AI interaction is supported by a custom API that processes user data and generates real-time responses, making the app feel interactive and supportive. Key features include:

ğŸ Meal logging and tracking of calories, macronutrients, and micronutrients
ğŸ“Š Visual summaries of daily and weekly nutrition trends
ğŸ¤– Real-time AI chat support for meal suggestions, nutrition guidance, and healthy reminders
ğŸ“¡ API-driven architecture for fast and responsive AI interactions

This project demonstrates backend API development, integration of AI services, and practical application of nutrition data management in a mobile or web environment.

Backend: API development using a modern framework (e.g., Node.js/Express or Python/Flask) to handle user data and AI requests.
AI Integration: Real-time AI interaction powered by a conversational AI model to provide nutrition guidance.
Data Management: Structured storage of food logs, nutrient values, and user history for accurate tracking.
Frontend: User interface built for easy meal logging and clear visual feedback.
Deployment: Hosted API and app for real-time access and interaction.

projects.title: MIA Chatbot Testing
projects.headline: ğŸ§ª MIA AI Chatbot Testing & Evaluation
projects.description:
The MIA AI Chatbot Testing project focuses on testing and evaluating an AI chatbot on MBH used for customer interactions.

This project simulates a real-world chatbot environment by testing MIA with different types of user questions. The goal is to check how well the chatbot responds, how consistent the answers are, and whether the responses are accurate and helpful. During testing, repeated questions and edge cases were used to observe patterns and limitations in the chatbotâ€™s behavior.

Key testing activities include:

ğŸ’¬ Creating realistic user questions and test scenarios
ğŸ” Checking response consistency for repeated and similar questions
âš ï¸ Identifying incorrect, unclear, or incomplete answers
ğŸ“‹ Recording chatbot limitations and common failure cases
ğŸ› ï¸ Suggesting improvements to improve answer quality and reliability

This project highlights the importance of testing AI chatbots before real-world use. The findings and recommendations help improve chatbot performance and build better user trust in enterprise and customer support systems.

Framework: AI chatbot testing approach.
Testing Method: Scenario-based testing and repeated question analysis.
Analysis: Manual review and comparison of chatbot responses.
Outcome: Clear findings and practical suggestions to improve chatbot quality.

projects.title: MBH Customer Feedback Analysis
projects.headline: ğŸ’¬ Customer Feedback Analysis
projects.description:
The Customer Feedback Analysis project focuses on analyzing customer feedback data collected during my internship at Maxis.

In this project, I worked with customer feedback data to understand common issues, customer concerns, and overall sentiment. The goal was to identify patterns in feedback and highlight areas that could be improved to enhance customer experience. Due to data confidentiality, this project focuses on the analysis process and insights rather than raw data.

Key tasks in this project include:

ğŸ“‹ Cleaning and organizing customer feedback data
ğŸ” Identifying common themes and repeated issues
ğŸ“Š Analyzing feedback trends and patterns
ğŸ§  Summarizing insights in a clear and simple way
ğŸ› ï¸ Providing suggestions to improve customer experience

This project shows how customer feedback can be used to support better decision-making and service improvements in a telco environment.

Framework: Customer feedback analysis workflow.
Methods: Text review, basic categorization, and trend analysis.
Analysis: Manual and simple analytical review of feedback data.
Outcome: Clear insights and practical recommendations for service improvement.

projects.title: Power BI Dashboard & Telco Data Analysis
projects.headline: ğŸ“Š Power BI Dashboard & Telco Reporting
projects.description:
I worked on creating interactive Power BI dashboards and analyzing telco data for reporting and performance tracking.

Key tasks included:

ğŸ“Œ Designing Power BI dashboards to visualize trends and performance for Bills, Account & Service Info, Roaming, Mobile Data, SIM, and Rewards.
ğŸ“Œ Updating CSM category and MBH transaction data, including counts, percentages, and unique transactions.
ğŸ“Œ Extracting and organizing quarterly charts (Q3 & Q4) to highlight trends and key metrics.
ğŸ“Œ Ensuring data accuracy and consistency before analysis and reporting.
ğŸ“Œ Verifying dashboards in Grafana to confirm metrics and tracking were correct.

This project demonstrates skills in **data visualization, cleaning, trend analysis, and dashboard verification**, showing how data insights support decision-making in a telco environment.

Tools: Power BI, Excel, Grafana.
Focus: Dashboard design, data analysis, reporting, and visualization.
Outcome: Clear and interactive dashboards with accurate, structured data ready for insights.
